metadata.title: CVE-2023-40283 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in l2cap_sock_release in net/bluetooth/l2cap_sock.cin the Linux kernel before 6.4.10. There is a use-after-free because thechildren of an sk are mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-40283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-generic - 4.4.0-245.279
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-245-lowlatency - 4.4.0-245.279
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-lowlatency - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-kvm - 4.4.0-1124.134
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1161-aws - 4.4.0-1161.176
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-aws - 4.15.0-1161.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1155-gcp - 4.15.0-1155.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-oracle - 4.15.0-1124.135~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-245.279').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1124.134').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1161.176').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1161.174~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1155.172~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.135~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
